text: the three series maybe BMWs bestseller
but like all automakers crossovers are
very important to the Bavarian brand I'm
Tom Volk with driven for the new york
times x-4 is the fifth crossover in BMWs
lineup though the company calls it a
sports activity coupe my sensible
Midwestern upbringing calls it less
useful but hey BMW certainly knows how
to move product these days you can think
of the x4 as an x3 with the back whacked
off or an x6 left in the dryer too long
x4 starts at forty five thousand six
hundred dollars this one fairly well
optioned retails for fifty seven for
part of the 12 grand job includes the
larger of two available engines this
three liter inline six-cylinder with a
twin scroll turbo delivers 300
horsepower and 300 pound feet of torque
all wheel drive is standard the gearbox
is an 8-speed automatic I find pmws
joystick bit awkward the driving
experience can be customized to suit
your mood torque comes on early
and stays constant up near the engines
redline zero-to-sixty is a punchy 5.2
seconds x4 is very nimble and fun to
drive it is BMW you may have heard they
have that reputation
things can get skittish on rough
pavement overall the firm ride quality
is comfortable but low-profile tires
transmit sharp bumps while there's a
hint of wind noise off the windshield
pillars the cabin is fairly quiet the
roof line might be car-like but the
center of gravity is definitely higher
than a 3-series
overall height of the x4 is about an
inch and a half lower than the x3 and
you do sit a little bit closer to the
road in this rig but ground clearance is
the same it's 8 inches few owners will
press x4 into severe off-road duty it
easily handles deeply rutted roads
there's hill descent control just in
case inside it's easy to tell this is a
BMW materials are as expected quite nice
the heated seats have just the right
amount of side bolstering iDrive is no
longer frustrating though I had to
consult the manual to tune the radio at
this price it could be argued a memory
steering wheel and a stitched crafted
dashboard should be included same with a
heated steering wheel and back at camera
both are optional the back door opening
is a bit small headroom is surprisingly
good considering the sloped roof line
it's probably due to the back seat
that's mounted low foot room could be
more generous heated rear seats are
optional phones can be charged stuff can
be stashed it's an OK space for two
people but getting car seats in and out
might be a chore
love that feature the fastback design of
the x4 gives up an awful lot of cargo
room compared to the more practical x3
handy stuff in the back includes this
simple but very useful band
there is no spare BMW is big on run-flat
tires X threes cargo hole is close to
twenty eight cubic feet x4 drops to
around eighteen scoring a six in the
tipi trunk test BMW seems intent on
providing a variant for every niche of
the market these days except for buyers
on budget x4 can climb to nearly 63
grand like the larger X 6 this fastback
crossover is a body style that only BMW
and its buyers seem to understand in the
end the sure-footed x4 offers more sport
less utility
Oh
